Reviews.Title: “Hope to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole2004
Reviews.Content: A welcoming mid priced hotel. Breakfast was fantastic, buffet as on hotel dexcription does not do it justice. Cereals, fresh fruit salad, peaches, flans , boiled eggs, salami/ ham cakes and bread were all plentifull and beautifully presented. The room was very clean and the maid, after thoroughly cleaning, changing towels in the morning etc came and tidied once or twice more each day, often we didn't need anything doing as we had been out. Shower was very efficient, though the cubicle may have seemed small by modern standards. Lots of marble throughout and the

Reviews.Title: “very disappoining”
Reviews.Author: spring298555
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel ,Piranesi . The price was reasonable; However, definitely not worth it. When we arrived, we Noticed That Were not clean the linens. There was mascara on one of the pillowcases. There was a hair in the coffeepot in the bedroom. The ice bucket filled HAD Been, yet, one of the glasses on the tray HAD lip marks on it. Not impressed at all!!! Moreover, Alesandro concierge was disrespectful towards us ....... perhaps does not like the foreigners?

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Well Appointed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mendonut
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3-nights over New Year's celebration. Room (#105) was modern, well appointed, roomy and sparkling clean. It has a small interior balcony. Hotel lobby and bar are small but also well appointed and well furnish. Service at the reception and bar was as expected in a 4-star hotel, cordial and professional. The hotel has a roof-top bar (closed for winter) but looked good and the view is spectacular. The hotel is less than half-block off the Piazza del Popolo. In sum, a good 4-star hotel (a bit pricey, but Rome good hotels are generally on the pricey side). We will definitely stay again in this hotel on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul N
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Family of four with two teenage kids. We had adjoining rooms. Rooms were a bit small but the location and friendliness of the staff more than made up for it. The breakfast was fine. Hotel recommended restaurant 59 for my daughter's birthday. It was wonderful. Everything is in walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic city hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: NukeMBA
Reviews.Content: Much to see and do within walking distance. Conveneient to public transportation. Great rooftop bar/restaurant. Very good breakfast. Some rooms have nice patio areas to enjoy the sounds of the night.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mia w
Reviews.Content: great hotel in the center of ancient Rome, the rooms are well furnished, the thing that we liked the most was the breakfast on the terrace where there is a spectacular view, even the concierge guys are funny, all young and gritty, the 'hotel is really good, I recommend it, sorry not to have appreciated the advice of the concierge to the restaurant they recommended Edy's restaurant was the worst meal of our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: qeen59
Reviews.Content: A hotel that can be friendly, are at the heart of Rome is a strategic place, the hotel also nice finished interior, the thing I do not approve of a hotel without restaurant should have valid points of reference, and when you ask them for advice can not you can send the worst restaurants of Rome as it happened to us, Restaurant S.ana, bad restaurant, I was outraged by this advice

Reviews.Title: “best situated, helpful staff and don't miss the roof”
Reviews.Author: swiss_ballad
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, rather small hotel built within an old palazzo, with a familiar atmosphere and helpful nice staff. It's situation is perfect, many beautiful places like Fontana Trevi, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona are near and within the pedestrian area. And of course Piazza del Popolo is just around the corner. The roof terrace facing Villa Borghese is magnificient, well worth having a drink there in a summer evening. Excellent shopping possibilities around, e.g. the Belstaff Flagstore just in front. The rooms are rather small. Drawback: no wireless and internet lan costs 10 Euro per day. Breakfast is ok. Tip: ask for the wonderful "marocchino" caffe. In summary I liked very much staying in this hotel which as a singular atmosphere and is optimal location

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and No AC!”
Reviews.Author: lekingjd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely overpriced and we had no ac in our junior suite. It was hot in ROME and one of the bedrooms in this tiny junior suite had no AC. We called about it, and they gave us the run around. We called again and got there is nothing we can do see about adjusting your bill in the AM. When we tried for an adjustment in the AM we were given the run around again. We had to sleep with the windows open. There was a huge political rally at the piazza next to the hotel which started with whistles and yelling at 6 am. It was awful! All would have been well had we gotten some accomodation on the bill. I will be fighting with my credit card next.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: GeeBeeUsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just 2 nights as part of an 18 day trip to Florence, Rome, London and Paris. A friend recommend this hotel to me so I made a reservation without really doing much research on other hotels. I do think, as others have noted, that it was a little expensive compared to other places we have stayed (we had just come from Florence and had a terrific, really spacious hotel room--actually more of an apartment). Our junior suite was definitely on the small side for a suite. But the room was very clean, the staff friendly and helpful for the most part (read a bit further to see what I mean) , and as I said, the hotel is in a very good location. And when you go to Rome, London, Paris, etc. everything is expensive so you just sort of get used to it! I actually liked the rooftop terrace. We went both evenings for a drink and I thought it was lovely (unlike a previous reviewer). My only complaint is that we were flying out of Rome at 6:00 p.m. on the day we checked out of the hotel. They kept our bags for us and when we returned, we asked if they could make change for a €20 bill (asked for two tens or four 5's--I don't remember) so we could tip the bellman (the hotel's own employee!) and maybe the cab driver. We were told that they would not do that for us because we had already checked out! That just seemed ridiculous to me. I really don't think we were asking for anything special or unusual. We had just paid €398 each night to stay there and they couldn't just trade us some smaller bills! So, even though the hotel was very nice, I can only give it an average rating because of that! Hotel management needs to realize that it's often the little things that stand out (good or bad)! And it's the little things that are so easy to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RStef
Reviews.Content: This hotel was suggested to us by our travel agent and what a wonderful suggestion it was! This small charming hotel was located very close to the Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps and made for a great central location for all our sightseeing trips. The staff was genuine and friendly. The room we had was located on the third floor of the hotel with a charming private terrace which gave us lovely views of the hillside and the Piazza. This boutique hotel was quiet, charning and comfortable, making our stay in Rome very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “solid but did not exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: abrhmsnm
Reviews.Content: reserved junior suite. hard to tell from web site what it really looked like. in reality was regular hotel room size. reminded me of new york hotels. bathroom was very small with shower in tub a little tight for anyone over 6 feet. on the plus side, bed was comfortable and we were on the highest floor and on the corner so it was quiet. service was solid. luca really knows his restaurants. breakfast was fine but did not include eggs like other hotels we stayed at in florence and positano. had access to internet through tv but wi-fi would be more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super clean, helpful staff...what else could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravel1229
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Rome and Tuscany. We spent two nights in Rome to take a guided tour of the sites. The hotel is a small boutique hotel next to the Piaza Del Popolo, in a really nice part of Rome. From the time that we walked in to the time we left, we didn't have a single negative experience. The rooms were spotless and the rooftop lounge was beautiful. There were six in our party we all agreed that the total experience was postitve, right down to the breakfast each morning. Yes, the rates are pricey but we absoluteley get what you paid for. This was a one in a lifetime chance for us to all travel together so we wanted to do it right....and we did.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travello2010
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 days at this hotel at the beginning of May. It's probably one of the best kept secrets in Rome. The staff is extremely friendly. Thank you Luca, Davide, Alessandro and Robby for all your help. The location is difficult to beat. I can't wait to return. Grazie Mille. J. Charette Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, expensive and noisy”
Reviews.Author: bnc2oths
Reviews.Content: For 288 euros we had the choice of a small 4th floor noisy street facing suite that was very small for 2 persons or a bottom floor suite that was larger and adequate. We made the mistake of selecting the bottom floor suite. It had a nice patio facing the courtyard so we thought great, it's quiet....until the neighboring apartments that share the courtyard had their security alarms go off 4 Times in one day in an earth shattering piercing way. Desk was powerless to stop the alarms. Lasted 2 days on an off. They wouldn't move us and at first said we were mistaken then admitted it happened often and the apt owners were away so they could do nothing. Also no wifi (Ethernet cord--really? ). Strongly advise against this hotel. Nice people but not that helpful. Bad experience. Poor fitness center. Rooms very hot so must open windows.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, price too expensive”
Reviews.Author: YossiAzoulay
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a weekend in Rome at the recommendation of a friend, the hotel is located in one of the busiest shopping city streets just steps from the Piazza di Popolo. All Rome's famous tourist attractions are within walking distance from the hotel. Breakfast is at an average not more and certainly not typical of such a high priced hotel. Any addition like scrambled eggs or freshly squeezed juice naturally be charged an amount of 5 euro. For use of sauna they charge a fee of 15 euro, and it is not justified in high price hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel..Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: aphillytraveler
Reviews.Content: We traveled Italy for 9 days with our teenage sons. This hotel was our favorite by far. The location couldnt have been better. We were able to walk to many places. The hotel is a small boutique type and has a great feel. Everyone was very friendly. We had two rooms - one on the 4th floor and suite 501, which is their best room, the Piranesi Suite. We absolutely loved 501. One of the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in. There was a roomy living room, comfortable bedroom, nice size bathroom, beatiful built ins all throughout the suite, small kitchen and a magnificent private pourch area. We werent able to use the porch due to the time of year we visited. The breaksfast was delicious - great variety - cheeses, meats, fruit, pastries, cereals, juices and the brew fresh coffee for each person. Room 401 was smaller, but my two teenage boys were perfectly comfortable in it. I would stay there again and recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jawga1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piranesi was wonderful. Great location and wonderful staff. Be sure you go to the top of the hotel, what a view !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Susan53437
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with my husband before departing on a cruise. The location is outstanding on Via Babuino between Spanish Steps and Piazza del Populo. Staff very helpful; hotel clean and quiet. Loved enjoying a drink at the end of the day on the rooftop terrace. Buffet breakfast fresh and sufficient for us. Our particular room was nicely appointed albeit the space a bit tight. However, we had a balcony which we enjoyed and gave the illusion of much more space with the doors open; the marble bathroom was quite roomy. Recommend Edy's for dinner...less than 5 minutes from the hotel. Head towards the Spanish Steps and I believe it was down the second or third alley on your left. Great food at a very decent price. Get the house red and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - worth a stay!”
Reviews.Author: mic1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Piranesi during a very nice period for Rome (autumn - less tourists, not too hot). The hotel's location is great - right next to Piazza del Popolo, 5 mins walk from the Spanish steps (and underground). The standard rooms are small but with a good layout. The service was very friendly and helpful. We did not have any experience with their f&b. If you go to Rome for a (long) weekend - this is really a hotel I can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: farawayNJ
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, well-appointed hotel in a great location just off Piazza del Popolo and close to Spanish Steps. The price is excellent given the quality and location, but the rooms are VERY small (as are most European hotel rooms). We had a queen-size bed that just barely fit in the room, so we were climbing over our suitcases to move around. My husband is 6'7" and the tiny stall shower presented a MAJOR challenge. For "normal size" people though, the hotel is a great value, especially given the prices of other hotels in the area. Breakfast (included) was terrific, with plenty of options (homemade baked goods, fresh fruit, yogurt, fantastic meats/cheeses). And the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE THIS HOTEL. PERFECT LOCATION IN ROME!”
Reviews.Author: CCHColorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Hotel Piranesi in Rome in May 2010. The location is perfect and we could walk everywhere. The hotel is elegant and clean and a wonderful value in Rome. We highly recomend the Hotel Piranesi!! Our room was large and had a sitting room and computer hook ups. They even have a lovely roof top bar with amazing views of the city and a work out room. We can't wait to go back to Rome and explore and shop some more!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Eric
Reviews.Content: This hotel has its plusses and minuses. We felt before (and after) arriving that its prices were fair, and we were ecstatic that we did not need to commit a lot of funds upfront to secure their best rate. We got one of the small 4th floor suites with terrace, and the terrace and its view are beautiful. The staff to a person is friendly, helpful and cares. The location, near Piazza del Popolo is good enough for me. On the downside, the room was quite small for a "suite', The breakfast was nothing special. There is no evening room service. Printing out boarding passes cannot be done on premises. The tv channels were a narrow selection. There was no clock radio nor wash cloth, and soap was Budget 6 type quality and size. These are quibbles perhaps, and just listed so you know that though this is a decent hotel, it is not a 5 star place by any fair measue. We were certainly satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mad_cow2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first leg of our honeymoon, and we really were not dissapointed! We recieved a free upgrade on booking and enjoyed the lovely garden room accomodation. We were also treated to a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room on arrival. The staff were very friendly and helpful and responded quickly to room service. The service we recieved was amazing, and staff really went out of their way to make us feel special, so thank you to them for that. The hotel was also conveniently situated and meant that we managed to get to all the must see sights of Rome on foot. I have taken away some amazing memories of Rome and I thank everyone at the hotel for contributing to this.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: kswim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Piranesi for 3 nights in late June and wish it could have been more! Not only is Rome a spectacular destination but this hotel was a joy to "come home to" every night. The front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming, the doorman recognized us walking up the street and greeted us back in, the staff in the dining room at breakfast (delicious and included) was very nice as well. We didn't make it to the rooftop garden cocktail reception but we popped up there late one evening and it was lovely. The bartender was cleaning up and entertained my kids with soccer tales. The staff definitely was a major plus. Our rooms were great! We booked two for our family of 4 with teens and they placed us in 2 rooms at the end of a hall with a locking privacy door that allowed us to open our two rooms to each other like a suite with 2 bdrms and 2 bathrooms. That was really nice. The rooms were beautifully decorated and furnished and were one of the nicer accomodations we had during our 3+ week trip in Europe, especially for the price. The location is good, just a short walk to the Flaminio metro station to reach the historic sites, a nice stroll to the spanish steps, and one block over from the Via del Corso shopping! I would definitely stay here again and hope I have the opportunity to do just that!

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to a Return Visit!”
Reviews.Author: elisaruland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Piranesi last spring along with 3 friends. We could not have been more pleased with the hotel. The location was perfect, the rooms were pleasant and clean, and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. We found ourselves looking forward to the delicious breakfast each morning in the lovely breakfast room, and then at the end of a day of sightseeing, a glass of wine in the cozy lobby. The bartender bent over backward to make us feel at home and waited on us hand and foot. The Piranesi is was of those hotels that you try to find in any European city - nice accommodations, friendly staff, good location and reasonably priced. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: patsydog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in a superior double. The room was spacious and had a lovely balcony. The location of the hotel is wonderful for sightseeing. It is just a few steps from the Piaza Popolo and about 2 mins. from the Spanish Steps. The staff were very knowledgeable and helpful, suggesting great restaraunts and making reservations for shows. The room is decorated in an empire style, all in yellows with uphostered walls. The only downside is the internet connection which costs about $20. a day. Breakfast is served in a nice room, and was quite extensive for a "continental" one. Lots of breads and sweet rolls, cheeses and cold cuts, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kaconway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 week tour of Italy. During the middle of our stay we decided to return to Rome the night before our flight instead of the day of. We had started our trip out with 2 nights at the Sofitel, but were not overly pleased with the accommodations and decided to try the Hotel Piranesi as it was listed in our guide book. We called and were able to book a junior suite. We arrived late after a long day of train travel. The reception was very welcoming. The front desk person even informed us of a strike happening the next day and offered to confirm our flight times. We were ushered into our suite and were pleased. Upholstered walls, hardwood floors and a beautiful bathroom, cedar lined closet, 3 balconies. The only complaint was the television was tiny and one of the bulky kinds, but we weren’t planning on being in the room so not a big deal. We took an evening stroll in the Piazza del Popolo and it was beautiful! We returned to the hotel and decided upon a nightcap at the bar. I had a bit of a cold so I asked the barman to prepare a hot toddy and told him the ingredients. It was perfect! He served us cake and a chocolate croissant to snack on. We hadn’t had dinner so this was a welcome treat. We spent some time in the sauna before we retired for the night. Breakfast the next morning was delightful and we took in the view from the roof top terrace before our departure. The concierge had arranged a private car to the airport upon our request. Everything was just wonderful and we certainly will return.

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: nlaketahoe
Reviews.Content: The single rooms are small and well laid out. The wall paper was worn and had a few obvious repairs making the room somewhat shabby. The bathrooms are up to date and very well appointed. My single room had a pretty walk out deck so be sure to request it as my friends room did not have this feature. My first night there I woke at 3:00 a.m. in unbelievable heat. Checking the next morning I found out that they shut off the AC at 12:00 to economize. I requested they not do that for the next three nights and they where kind enough to accommodate me. The breakfast is in the basement. It was very stuffy no A/C but the room is pretty. The front desk also does the concierge work. They were all very nice and helpful but sometimes busy convenient. It was a very convenient location but not a good value, very average.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, elegant, and for those in the know”
Reviews.Author: teatoo
Reviews.Content: My family (my wife, our daughter, and my parents) had a remarkable stay at the Piranesi. We live in Italy part of the year and are familiar with Rome and its hotels. This was our first visit to the Piranesi and we will return. The hotel itself has a smart, elegant feel without ovetones of any aloofness or pretension. The rooms have a clean, sharp look that are inviting and combine warm wood tones with crisp linens. The terraces, french doors, and high ceilings add the perfect compliment to the directoire style furniture. This is not of course forgeting the modern, marble bathrooms and air conditioning that will be appreciated by any of us who insist upon visiting Rome in the summer. The roof top bar is fab! Looking out over the Piazza del Popolo and the Borghese gardens drives home the realization that the Piranesi is in the premier area of Rome for fun, elegance, and, oh, by the way, two Caravaggios accross the square. Yes, you could stay at the de Russie (literally, accross the street)and pay three times as much, but why? Enjoy Rome, and spend your time and money on other memories than a hotel bill. Sir Michael Farell Massa, KHS Lady Wendy Alison Massa, LHS

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LHFlynn
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located on Via del Babuino between Piazza del Popolo & the Spanish Steps, opposite the De Russie Hotel Rated 4 stars, but should be a maximum of 3 stars, principally because of its location. Additionally, we were NOT told that one cannot drive right up to the front door … traffic is restricted and only those who are licensed (i.e. taxis) are permitted on the road. After driving in circles around the Giardini Borghesi entirely too many times, we finally phoned the hotel to learn that they would send the doorman to meet up on the other side of the Piazza del Popolo and he would guide us back to the hotel. Once my son, daughter and I departed with him, my husband had to return the car to Europcar in a subterranean parking lot and make his way to the hotel. He was exhausted and dripping wet by the time he arrived … he ended up taking a rather long and roundabout route that had been recommended by Europcar. He desperately needed a shower and a drink!!! We booked a jr. suite which turned out to be a largish room with a double bed and 2 roll away cots. The mattresses were hard, the sheets not high quality, no extra pillows. The bathtub/shower was so poorly designed that it leaked every time one took a shower. We had to ask for extra towels.  No Internet because the owners are still thinking about it (this is not 1990! and a hotel in Rome that represents itself as a 4 star hotel should have internet access!) I had to walk to an Internet café on the other side of the Piazza del Popolo to check e-mail. Breakfast was the standard cold meats, cereal, fruit salad, etc. The staff cleaning up in, what appeared to be, a kitchen adjacent to the dining room was very noisy. We would have been thrilled had it been rated a 2 star hotel, but it wasn’t. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: washdctrav7
Reviews.Content: The BEST part of this hotel is that is is newly renovated (new, clean bathrooms, floors and furniture) and it is directly across from the Hotel de Rossie, which is the nicest hotel in Rome... So, when I stay there, I walk across the street for the Rossie amenities (including use of their concierge for my reservations etc)..... The questionable part of the Hotel is that it is very Italian -- room sizes and prices vary greatly. If you speak some Italian or can work the system, you can get an excellent value. The small rooms are small but OK for a single traveler. If you are a couple, and are not able to assert yourself, you do run a risk here which is why I hold back one star from the hotel that I find to be the best deal in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful position”
Reviews.Author: middleagedlawyer
Reviews.Content: have stayed here twice before and really loved it . Disappointed therefore to find that the bathroom and room were not as clean as they could be! The roof terrace was delightful apart from the three american children who played ball around one as we tried to have a quiet drink after an exhausting day - no comment on this from the bar staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: cinephile126
Reviews.Content: The location was terrific and the people couldn't have been nicer. My room was quite nice, and the breakfast was good. Would stay here again, but I had stayed two nights before at the Valadier around the corner, which couldn't accommodate me the whole time. The Valadier is a little more stylish, and less expensive, which I can't figure. I'd probably stay at the Valadier next time, but if it's booked, and you don't mind spending a little more, the Piranesi is still a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYVMAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It is above average hotel with considerably expensive price tag. The room was booked by our agent. The rooms are very small, but it was fine for us since we spent most of the day outside anyway, it's just I wish it was less expensive. The location is very good, there is some street noise, but that is the price to pay for such a central location, very convenient. The room, the bathroom was very clean, the breakfast was good, could be much better and I agree with the reviewers who said the breakfast room was too small and stuffy, it is basically in the basement below the lobby, and they could have done a much better job of designing it. The staff were excellent very friendly, very helpful, over all very positive experience. I will recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “basic touristy hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time searching for a hotel in rome, including on the trip advisor web site, and selected the piranesi based mainly on the reviews here. The hotel clearly photographs well, but it does not live up to the reviews or to claims on its web site. It is a fairly basic tourist class hotel, which is fine, but in this case you are being charged for a 4 star hotel. Aside from general false advertising, specific problems that i had included a disfunctional shower head, and no maid service. And, judged by rome standards as well as european standards, the room that i was assigned was exceptionally small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingfamilySF
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Piranesi is definitely a nice boutique hotel. We had a suite and a standard room with a balcony. If you stay, I would book the standard vs. the suite. The only advantage the suite gave us was a extra sitting room which to me was useless. The rooms and bathrooms were small but very nicely done. The balcony did not have a view, but was a nice size to sit out and just relax after a busy day of sightseeing. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel itself was in a very good location near the spanish steps and the main retail shopping area. They have a wonderful view from their rooftop bar area. Breakfast was simple, but good. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. I think it is a tad overpriced, but when I booked the euro was very high

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kathryninfl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Piranesi for 2 days this June. Prior to arriving, and during our stay, we found the hotel staff to be very accomodating and helpful. The room and bath was small, but clean and efficient, with a nice decor. We had a great little balcony/terrace that we really enjoyed. The hotel itself is in an excellent location, very close to alot of great sights. They had a wonderful rooftop terrace, and the bartender was extremely nice. The drinks were somewhat expensive, but we found Rome in general to be expensive, so I can't say that the drinks were completely overpriced. We had a great time, just a few minor notes. Our air conditioner in our room was not working half the time, and it made the room somewhat stuffy and it smelled a bit as a result. We did not care for the breakfast, which was held in a very small room below the lobby. After the first day, we did not attempt to eat there again, and the service in the kitchen room was pretty slow. I would stay there again, though it was kind of pricey. However, we stayed in high season. Good location, nice room, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and delightful! a pleasure to stay in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited in sept 2004: A delightful hotel and one we will return to time and time again. the staff were wonderful, the rooms ever so clean and well maintained. we were upgraded to a delux room with balcony overlooking the Piazza del Popolo, the breakfast buffet was v pleasant and although the rooms were small (probably not so by Rome standards) it felt much larger with the balcony. stunning views and a lovely ambiance. we will stay here time and time again, and are infact making another trip back in May with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mirandarose
Reviews.Content: We felt welcomed, safe, and comfortable at this small hotel. The owners (who have a store next door) have covered all their bases. It is well maintained, beautifully appointed, and quiet. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. We are an older couple and for us the location was a delight. There is a nearby, always filled, taxi stand without the hoard of tourists standing in line waiting for a taxi, and to return all we would have to say to the taxi driver is Piazza de Popolo. We used their car service from Civitavecchia and it was actually competitive in price. This hotel is a good value in an expensive town and we hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Piranesi - a wonderful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Trip Advisor from Dallas, TX
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the lovely Hotel Piranesi. We were a family of 4 traveling with 2 children. We had a wonderful suite which was spacious enough for all 4 of us. This hotel is very small, only 32 rooms, but a wonderful staff & location for exploring Rome. The rooms are beautiflly appointed with new bathrooms. The breakfast was delightful as well as the rooftop terrace for cocktails and views of Rome. You will love this small, beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 quiet nights in June here and had a very pleasant stay. Staff extremely helpful, wonderful breakfast served in well decorated room. Roof top optional. Room was parquet floor, good AC, very small shower but had to move rooms later in teh week and the shower was quite larger. Fabric on walls helps to muffle noise. Nice decor. Great location near shopping adn small neighborhood restaurants. A hop to Piazza del Populo. I would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in may of 2003--terrific location across the roard from the very expensive Hotel De Ruisse-- good breakfast room, charming rooms and most helpful staff --great value--small and delightful.

HotelInfo.Name: Piranesi Palazzo Nainer Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Babuino, 196, 00187 Rome, Italy
